Package stincmale.ratmex.executor

Interface RateMeasuringExecutorService<C extends ScheduledTaskConfig<E>,E extends RateMeasuredEvent>

  • Type Parameters:
    C - A type of scheduled task config used in #scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, Rate, C).
    E - A type of container with data provided to a rate listener.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.concurrent.Executor, java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService

    @ThreadSafe
public interface RateMeasuringExecutorService<C extends ScheduledTaskConfig<E>,E extends RateMeasuredEvent>
extends java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A rate-measuring executor service which not only executes tasks with a fixed rate, but also measures the actual rate completion of the tasks and allows one to monitor the rate and react if the executor has failed to conform to the target rate.

    The reasoning behind RateMeasuringExecutorService
    The functionality described by this interface cannot be directly obtained from ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit), which says the following regarding the task being scheduled: "If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late, but will not concurrently execute". This tells us that:

    • ScheduledExecutorService is allowed to execute tasks with a lower rate than the target (and there is no easy way to check).
    • ScheduledExecutorService executes a scheduled task serially, which means that you cannot easily benefit from multithreading, and the rate is heavily limited by the time the task takes to complete.
    RateMeasuringExecutorService overcomes both of the above points.

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleAtFixedRate

        java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleAtFixedRate​(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                                            Rate targetRate,
                                                            C config)
        Schedules a task to be executed with a fixed rate.

        The repeated execution of the task continues indefinitely until one of the following exceptional completions occur:

        • The task is explicitly cancelled via the returned future.
        • The executor terminates, also resulting in task cancellation.
        • An execution of the task throws a RuntimeException. In this case calling get() on the returned future will throw ExecutionException.
        • The scheduled task times out.
        • The rate listener's method RateListener.onMeasurement(RateMeasuredEvent) returns false, also resulting in task cancellation.
        Subsequent executions are suppressed. Subsequent calls to isDone() on the returned future will return true.
        Parameters:
        task - A task to schedule for repetitive execution. Must not be null.
        targetRate - A target rate of completion of the task executions. Must not be null.
        config - An additional configuration. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the task. The future's get() method will never return normally, and will throw an exception upon task cancellation or abnormal termination of a task execution.

      • close

        default void close​()
        This method is equivalent to calling ExecutorService.shutdownNow(). Subclasses may extend this behaviour, but must always call ExecutorService.shutdownNow().
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
